clean_content:
Definition / general

* Rare, benign soft tissue tumor with striking predilection for the anterior dorsal tongue* First named by Smith et al. in 1995 ([Am J Surg Pathol 1995;19:519](7726361))

Essential features

* Most are found on the anterior dorsal tongue* Fewer than 120 well documented cases have been reported* Histopathologically demonstrates a well defined, often multilobulated tumor with ovoid, round, fusiform or polygonal cells within a sometimes myxoid, chondromyxoid or mucoid background* Reticular arrangement of cells is often noted* Characterized by *RREB1::MRTFB* (previously *MKL2*) fusion in 90% of cases ([Am J Surg Pathol 2018;42:1297](29912715))* Conservative excision recommended; < 10% have recurred

Terminology

* Ectomesenchymal chondromyxoid tumor of the anterior tongue ([Am J Surg Pathol 1995;19:519](7726361))

ICD coding

* ICD-10: [D10.1](https://www.icd10data.com/ICD10CM/Codes/C00-D49/D10-D36/D10-/D10.1) - benign neoplasm of tongue

Epidemiology

* No sex predilection* Average age ~40 years* Age range is from 2.3 - 78 years ([Cleft Palate Craniofac J 2022;59:932](34459667), [Am J Surg Pathol 1995;19:519](7726361))

Sites

* Striking predilection for anterior dorsal tongue* Rare cases reported in other oral locations
    + Posterior tongue / base of tongue ([Am J Surg Pathol 2018;42:1297](29912715), [Cleft Palate Craniofac J 2022;59:932](34459667), [Head Neck Pathol 2014;8:329](24288100), [Oral Oncol 2017;67:192](28351576))+ Gingiva / anterior hard palate ([Int J Oral Sci 2018;10:4](29491357), [Oral Surg Oral Med Oral Pathol Oral Radiol 2012;114:154](22769404))+ Buccal mucosa ([J Am Dent Assoc 2015;146:196](25726348))+ Mandible ([Head Neck Pathol 2021;15:319](32372271))* Cases with the same *RREB1::MRTFB* fusion and overlapping morphologic features have been noted in extraoral sites* It is unclear whether these tumors are completely different entities or if they represent a variation of ectomesenchymal chondromyxoid tumor
        + Mediastinum ([Histopathology 2020;76:1023](31991003))+ Maxillo-ethmoidal angle, reported as a biphenotypic sinonasal sarcoma ([Genes Chromosomes Cancer 2021;60:565](33715240))+ Oropharynx, reported as a biphenotypic oropharyngeal sarcoma ([Genes Chromosomes Cancer 2018;57:203](29266774))

Etiology

* Currently considered as tumors of uncertain histogenesis by WHO classification* Most authors support neural crest origin ([Am J Surg Pathol 1995;19:519](7726361))
    + Supported by the fact that the anterior tongue derives from the neural crest mesenchyme of the first branchial arch ([Head Neck Pathol 2015;9:315](25404177))+ Pluripotency of the neural crest may explain the significant immunohistochemical variability ([Oral Surg Oral Med Oral Pathol Oral Radiol 2021;132:4](33012672), [Oral Oncol 2006;42:1026](17011812))+ Markers for undifferentiated embryonic stem cells (OCT 3/4, SOX2, Nanog, MAP2, CD105 mRNAs) have been found in ectomesenchymal chondromyxoid tumors ([Oral Surg Oral Med Oral Pathol Oral Radiol 2013;115:233](23312916))* Some authors cite potential link between ectomesenchymal chondromyxoid tumor and myoepithelioma of soft parts ([Oral Surg Oral Med Oral Pathol Oral Radiol Endod 2005;99:581](15829881), [Histopathology 2016;69:607](27010880))

Clinical features

* Slow growing, usually asymptomatic, firm submucosal nodule on anterior dorsal tongue* Purulent drainage noted in one case report ([Anticancer Research 2010;30:4685](https://ar.iiarjournals.org/content/anticanres/30/11/4685.full.pdf))* Tumor size ranges from 0.3 - 4.0 cm ([Am J Surg Pathol 1995;19:519](7726361), [Oral Oncol 2017;67:192](28351576))* Pain is rarely noted ([Advances in Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery 2021;1:100006](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.adoms.2020.100006))

Diagnosis

* Diagnosis is made on histopathological examination

Radiology description

* Isointense signal or low intensity signal on T1 weighted MRI and hyperintense signal on T2 weighted MRI ([Oral Surg Oral Med Oral Pathol Oral Radiol 2013;115:233](23312916), [Oral Oncol 2017;67:192](28351576), [BMJ Case Rep 2019;12:e231278](31653634))* Case detailing CT scan without contrast shows cystic appearing lesion with hemorrhagic areas ([Head Neck Pathol 2014;8:329](24288100))

Radiology images

*Images hosted on other servers:*  

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavityectthumbimg01.jpg)](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/24288100/#&gid=article-figures&pid=fig-1-uid-0)

Cystic appearing mass

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavityectthumbimg02.jpg)](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/31653634/#&gid=article-figures&pid=figure-2-uid-1)

T1 weighted image, MRI

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavityectthumbimg03.jpg)](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/31653634/#&gid=article-figures&pid=figure-3-uid-2)

T2 weighted image, MRI

Prognostic factors

* 5 cases (< 10% of reported cases with follow up information) are reported to have recurred ([Am J Surg Pathol 2018;42:1297](29912715), [Am J Surg Pathol 1995;19:519](7726361), [Oral Surg Oral Med Oral Pathol Oral Radiol Endod 2009;108:e20](19716722))* Local re-excision appears curative ([Oral Dis 2008;14:390](18593455))

Case reports

* 26 year old woman with slow growing nodule on the anterior dorsal tongue ([Advances in Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery 2021;1:100006](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.adoms.2020.100006))* 37 year old woman with expansile radiolucency in the body of the mandible ([Head Neck Pathol 2021;15:319](32372271))* 43 year old man with mass on posterior dorsal tongue ([Head Neck Pathol 2014;8:329](24288100))* 46 year old man with anterior dorsal tongue mass, present for 5 years ([BMJ Case Rep 2019;12:e231278](31653634))

Treatment

* Conservative surgical excision is recommended ([Int J Surg Case Rep 2017;41:162](29080442), [Oral Dis 2008;14:390](18593455))

Clinical images

*Images hosted on other servers:*  

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavityectthumbimg04.jpg)](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/31653634/#&gid=article-figures&pid=figure-1-uid-0)

Submucosal nodule

Gross description

* Firm, well defined tumor* White, tan, yellow or gray in color ([Am J Surg Pathol 1995;19:519](7726361), [Acta Cytol 2010;54:82](20306996), [Oral Surg Oral Med Oral Pathol Oral Radiol 2021;132:4](33012672))* Cystic, gelatinous or hemorrhagic areas often are described ([Virchows Arch 2003;442:302](12647223), [Int J Surg Pathol 2016;24:586](27240862), [Oral Surg Oral Med Oral Pathol Oral Radiol 2021;132:4](33012672))

Gross images

*Images hosted on other servers:*  

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavityectthumbimg05.jpg)](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/24288100/#&gid=article-figures&pid=fig-2-uid-1)

Well circumscribed, tan, hemorrhagic mass

Microscopic (histologic) description

* Well demarcated tumor, often entrapped within skeletal muscle and frequently multilobulated ([Am J Surg Pathol 2018;42:1297](29912715), [Head Neck Pathol 2015;9:315](25404177))* Stromal background may be hyalinized or demonstrate mucoid, myxoid or chondromyxoid areas* Cords, strands or sheets of oval, round, fusiform or polygonal bland cells, sometimes arranged in a reticular / net-like or globoid pattern ([Am J Surg Pathol 2018;42:1297](29912715))* Myxoglobulosis-like changes have been noted ([Virchows Arch 2003;442:302](12647223))* May focally demonstrate fine calcifications, cellular atypia, necrosis, multinucleated giant cells ([Am J Surg Pathol 2018;42:1297](29912715), [Head Neck Pathol 2015;9:315](25404177), [Oral Surg Oral Med Oral Pathol Oral Radiol Endod 1996;82:417](8899780))* Cystic, slit-like spaces or hemorrhagic areas often noted ([Head Neck Pathol 2014;8:329](24288100))* Mitotic figures not seen ([Head Neck Pathol 2015;9:315](25404177))

Microscopic (histologic) images

Contributed by Molly Housley Smith, D.M.D.  

[![Prominent hemorrhagic areas](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityectHousleySmith001.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityectHousleySmith001.jpg)

Prominent hemorrhagic areas

[![Entrapment within muscle](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityectHousleySmith02.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityectHousleySmith02.jpg)

Entrapment within muscle

[![Focal papillary growth pattern](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityectHousleySmith03.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityectHousleySmith03.jpg)

Focal papillary growth pattern

[![Chondromyxoid stroma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityectHousleySmith04.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityectHousleySmith04.jpg)

Chondromyxoid stroma

[![Hemosiderin breakdown products](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityectHousleySmith05.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityectHousleySmith05.jpg)

Hemosiderin breakdown products

  

[![Sheets of ovoid cells](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityectHousleySmith06.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityectHousleySmith06.jpg)

Sheets of ovoid cells

[![Reticular pattern](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityectHousleySmith07.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityectHousleySmith07.jpg)

Reticular pattern

[![Chondromyxoid stroma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityectHousleySmith08.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityectHousleySmith08.jpg)

Chondromyxoid stroma

[![Ovoid nuclei](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityectHousleySmith09.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityectHousleySmith09.jpg)

Ovoid nuclei

[![GFAP](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityectHousleySmith10.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityectHousleySmith10.jpg)

GFAP

Virtual slides

*Images hosted on other servers:*  

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavityectthumbimg06.jpg)](https://www.pathology.med.umich.edu/slides/oldfilmstrip.php?loc=SCUyNkVfOTU3MDZubC5zdnM=&myname=95706&stain=H%26E)

Multilobulated tumor

Cytology description

* Overlapping features with pleomorphic adenoma ([Acta Cytol 2010;54:82](20306996), [Oral Oncol 2003;39:83](12457726))* Cellular, with abundant thick to myxoid fibrillary stromal elements ([Acta Cytol 2010;54:82](20306996))* Clusters of oval, spindled or polygonal cells with uniform nuclei ([Acta Cytol 2010;54:82](20306996))* Lacking mitotic figures ([Acta Cytol 2010;54:82](20306996))

Positive stains

* [Glial fibrillary acidic protein (GFAP)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsgfap.html) ~90% ([Head Neck Pathol 2015;9:315](25404177))* [S100](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainss100.html) protein > 90%* [CD56](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd56.html) and [CD57](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd57.html) > 50% ([Head Neck Pathol 2015;9:315](25404177))* Authors often attribute the immunodiversity to the pluripotency of the neural crest origin* Many other markers, such as [SMA](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsalphasmoothmuscleactin.html), [p63](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsp63.html), [cytokeratin](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsckgeneral.html), [desmin](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsdesmin.html) and [SOX10](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainssox10.html), are positive in a subset (< 50%) ([Head Neck Pathol 2015;9:315](25404177), [Int J Surg Pathol 2016;24:586](27240862), [Oral Surg Oral Med Oral Pathol Oral Radiol Endod 2010;110:e48](20955943))

Negative stains

* [EMA](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsema.html) typically negative

Electron microscopy description

* Electron microscopy is not specific ([Int J Surg Pathol 2016;24:586](27240862))* Lobulated, concave nuclei; well developed rough endoplasmic reticulum; intermediate filament bundles ([Int J Surg Pathol 2016;24:586](27240862), [Oral Surg Oral Med Oral Pathol Oral Radiol Endod 1996;82:417](8899780))

Molecular / cytogenetics description

* *RREB1::MRTFB* (previously *MKL2*) gene fusion (RNA sequencing and FISH) ([Am J Surg Pathol 2018;42:1297](29912715))* *EWSR1::CREM* fusion product found in 1/21 cases and 3/11 cases showed *EWSR1* rearrangement on FISH ([Am J Surg Pathol 2018;42:1297](29912715), [Histopathology 2016;69:607](27010880))
    + Unclear at this point whether *EWSR1* rearranged ectomesenchymal chondromyxoid tumors represent a separate entity or part of the spectrum of ectomesenchymal chondromyxoid tumors

Molecular / cytogenetics images

*Images hosted on other servers:*  

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavityectthumbimg07.jpg)](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/29912715/#&gid=article-figures&pid=figure-4-uid-3)

FISH rearrangement of *RREB1* and *MRTFB*

Sample pathology report

* Anterior tongue, excision:
  + Ectomesenchymal chondromyxoid tumor

Differential diagnosis

* [Soft tissue myoepithelioma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/softtissuemyoepithelialca.html):
  + Due to the overlapping morphologic, immunohistochemical and molecular findings (*EWSR1* rearrangements), some authors note significant overlap or potential link between soft tissue myoepithelioma and ectomesenchymal chondromyxoid tumor ([Oral Surg Oral Med Oral Pathol Oral Radiol Endod 2005;99:581](15829881), [Histopathology 2016;69:607](27010880))* [Pleomorphic adenoma / salivary myoepithelioma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/salivaryglandsmyoepithelioma.html):
    + Do not occur on the anterior dorsal tongue due to the lack of salivary glands in this area+ *PLAG1* aberrations not found in ectomesenchymal chondromyxoid tumors ([Histopathology 2016;69:607](27010880))* [Oral focal mucinosis](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/oralcavityoralfocalmucinosis.html):
      + Stroma positive for [PAS](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainspas.html) and [Alcian blue](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsalcianblue.html) ([Head Neck Pathol 2015;9:315](25404177))+ Less cellular than ectomesenchymal chondromyxoid tumors+ Most commonly found on the gingiva* [Neurothekeoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/softtissueneurothekeoma.html):
        + Positive with [NKI / C3 (CD63)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd63.html), [MITF](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsmitf.html) ([Head Neck Pathol 2015;9:315](25404177))+ Negative with [S100](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainss100.html), [GFAP](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsgfap.html), [CD57](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd57.html), [cytokeratin](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsckgeneral.html) ([Oral Surg Oral Med Oral Pathol Oral Radiol Endod 1996;82:417](8899780))* [Reticular perineurioma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/softtissueperineurioma.html):
          + [EMA](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsema.html) positive ([Virchows Arch 2005;447:677](16133356))+ [GLUT1](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsglut1.html) and [claudin1](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsclaudins.html) often positive+ Negative with [S100](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainss100.html), [GFAP](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsgfap.html), [CD57](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd57.html), [cytokeratin](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsckgeneral.html)* Clinical differential diagnosis for a submucosal nodule on the dorsal tongue most often includes [fibroma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/oralcavityirritationfibroma.html) / [fibrous hyperplasia](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/oralcavityinflamfibroushyperplasia.html), [granular cell tumor](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/oralcavitygct.html) or [cartilaginous](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/oralcavitychoristoma.html) / [osseous choristoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/oralcavitychoristoma.html), all of which can easily be differentiated from an ectomesenchymal chondromyxoid tumor by biopsy* [*GLI1* altered mesenchymal tumors](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/softtissuewhoclassificationgi.html):
              + Both tumors have a propensity to oral tongue location, multilobulated to nodular growth pattern and immunopositivity of [SMA](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsalphasmoothmuscleactin.html), [S100](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainss100.html) and [keratins](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsckgeneral.html)+ *GLI1* altered mesenchymal tumors have epithelioid morphology, arborizing capillary network and show *GLI1* amplification or *GLI1* translocation at molecular level ([Am J Surg Pathol 2020;44:729](31934916))
